metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the Zhangye wetland station eddy covariance system (EC) in the flux observation matrix from 25 June to 26 September, 2012. The site (100.44640° E, 38.97514° N) was located in a wetland surface, which is near Zhangye city, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1460.00 m. The EC was installed at a height of 5.2 m; the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (Gill&Li7500A) was 0.25 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software (Li-Cor Company, http://www.licor.com/env/products/ eddy_covariance/software.html), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, angle of attack correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2012年6月25日至9月26日的通量观测矩阵中湿地站涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市，下垫面是湿地。观测点的经纬度是100.44640E, 38.97514N，海拔1460.00m。涡动相关仪架高5.2m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是25cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，角度订正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比–能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当 irrigated farmland 的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下对冠层温度的高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及在4.5米高处使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度通量系统测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，旨在研究异质土地表面的蒸散发，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上尺度化是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'multiscale observation' mean in the context of eco-hydrological research in oasis-desert systems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的生态水文研究中，“多尺度观测”指的是在不同空间和时间尺度上进行的观察和测量，以便更全面地理解生态和水文过程的相互作用。
Definition.AnswerEn: Multiscale observation in the context of eco-hydrological research refers to the collection of data at different spatial and temporal scales to capture the complex interactions and processes across a heterogeneous landscape, such as an oasis-desert system. This involves using a hierarchical arrangement of instruments, such as eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and imaging spectrometers. The aim is to obtain comprehensive data that can inform models of eco-hydrological processes, enabling researchers to understand and predict interactions between the oasis and surrounding desert environments.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测在生态水文研究中的意义是指在不同的空间和时间尺度上收集数据，以捕捉异质景观（如绿洲-沙漠系统）中的复杂相互作用和过程。这涉及使用分层排列的仪器，如涡度协方差塔、自动气象站以及遥感技术，如激光雷达和成像光谱仪。其目的是获取全面的数据，以便为生态水文过程模型提供信息，使研究人员能够理解和预测绿洲与周围沙漠环境之间的相互作用。

Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The limited effectiveness of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions is due to classification errors in images, which vary with vegetation abundance, and the presence of atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, leading to uncertainties in temperature estimations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，复合温度分离方法的有限有效性是由于图像中的分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，并且存在大气上升辐射和透射率，导致温度估算的不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of utilizing a multi-scale observation experiment for understanding eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用多尺度观测实验来理解异质表面的生态水文过程的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing a multi-scale observation experiment allows for the collection of diverse and multidisciplinary data, which can help overcome the challenge of poor availability of such observations. It enables capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes through hierarchical instrumentation, facilitating a more comprehensive understanding of these processes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用多尺度观测实验可以收集多样化和多学科的数据，这有助于克服观测可用性差的挑战。它通过分层仪器捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，从而促进对这些过程的更全面理解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the outcomes of implementing an eddy covariance system in the measurement of evapotranspiration within irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在灌溉农业区域实施涡度协方差系统测量蒸散发的结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing an eddy covariance system allows for the measurement of latent heat fluxes, which can be used to estimate evapotranspiration. However, it can introduce uncertainties in the measurements, especially under strong advective conditions, due to potential errors in energy balance closure and surface-air temperature difference.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施涡度协方差系统可以测量潜热通量，这可以用来估算蒸散发。然而，在强对流条件下，这可能会引入测量的不确定性，尤其是由于能量平衡闭合和表面-空气温度差异的潜在误差。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to conduct multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection for eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质表面上进行多尺度和多学科的数据收集对于生态水文过程的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Progress in understanding eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The HiWATER experiment addresses this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 对异质表面生态水文过程的理解进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验通过在分层嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended outcomes of using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures for estimating evapotranspiration?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度来估算蒸散发的预期结果是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration using soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera and to better validate these estimates using a combination of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques and eddy covariance measurements.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层温度来估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散，并通过结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度协方差测量来更好地验证这些估算。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are eddy covariance systems used in the collection of flux data over heterogeneous landscapes, and what are the procedural steps involved in ensuring data quality and accuracy?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统如何在异质景观上收集通量数据，以及确保数据质量和准确性的程序步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance (EC) systems are used to measure turbulent fluxes by collecting data at a high sampling frequency, typically 10 Hz. The procedural steps involve installing the EC system at a specific height, such as 5.2 m in the case of wetland sites, and using software like Edire for post-processing. This includes removing outliers, correcting for time delays, angle corrections, coordinate rotations, frequency response corrections, and density corrections. Quality checks are performed by evaluating atmospheric stability and turbulence characteristics, and data is screened for instrument errors, precipitation effects, and data gaps.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差（EC）系统用于通过以高采样频率（通常为10 Hz）收集数据来测量湍流通量。程序步骤包括将EC系统安装在特定高度，例如在湿地站点的5.2米处，并使用像Edire这样的软件进行后处理。这包括去除异常值、修正时间延迟、角度修正、坐标旋转、频率响应修正和密度修正。通过评估大气稳定性和湍流特征进行质量检查，并对仪器错误、降水影响和数据缺口进行数据筛选。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are adopted to ensure the integration and quality control of multiscale datasets collected during eco-hydrological experiments in oasis-desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的生态水文实验中，为确保多尺度数据集的整合和质量控制，采用了哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The integration and quality control of multiscale datasets involve using a flux observation matrix, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing. Data from eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations are collected alongside vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis ground measurements. Quality control procedures include sensor calibration, systematic data collection, and processing, as well as generating datasets for analysis. This multi-tiered approach ensures accuracy and reliability, with data made available through platforms like figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度数据集的集成和质量控制涉及使用通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感。收集来自涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站的数据，同时进行植被动态和光合作用的地面测量。质量控制程序包括传感器校准、系统数据收集和处理，以及生成用于分析的数据集。这种多层次的方法确保了数据的准确性和可靠性，数据通过figshare和寒冷与干旱地区科学数据中心等平台提供。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or technologies enable the accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或技术能够在异质景观中准确地将蒸散发分为蒸发和植物蒸腾？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration in heterogeneous landscapes is enabled by the use of ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, high-resolution thermal cameras, and the application of the TSEB model. This approach is validated using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes and eddy covariance measurements.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中，利用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度、高分辨率热成像相机以及TSEB模型，可以准确地将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾。该方法通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及涡度协方差测量进行了验证。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the accuracy of surface flux estimations be affected when using composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，使用复合温度分离方法时，表面通量估计的准确性可能会受到影响的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The accuracy of surface flux estimations might be affected due to limitations in the effectiveness of current composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions. Errors in the derived component temperature can be caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can produce uncertainties in the estimated temperatures, affecting the accuracy of surface flux estimations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 表面通量估计的准确性可能受到当前复合温度分离方法在干旱地区有效性限制的影响。派生的组成温度可能因图像分类错误而产生误差，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。此外，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能会导致估计温度的不确定性，从而影响表面通量估计的准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might researchers face when attempting to upscale eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces using multiscale observations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 研究人员在尝试使用多尺度观测对异质表面进行生态水文过程的上尺度时，可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Researchers might face challenges due to the poor availability of multiscale observations. Progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes is hindered by the lack of sufficient multiscale data, which is necessary to capture the complexity of heterogeneous surfaces. The HiWATER experiment, for instance, aims to address this challenge by obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data through hierarchically nested instrumentation.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 研究人员可能会面临由于多尺度观测的可用性差而带来的挑战。生态水文过程的上尺度化进展受到缺乏足够的多尺度数据的阻碍，而这些数据对于捕捉异质表面的复杂性是必要的。例如，HiWATER实验旨在通过分层嵌套的仪器获取多尺度和多学科的数据，以应对这一挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of using a combination of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques and eddy covariance measurements for validating evapotranspiration models in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在异质景观中使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度协方差测量相结合来验证蒸散发模型的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The combination of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques with eddy covariance measurements appears to provide a robust validation approach for evapotranspiration models in heterogeneous landscapes. It allows for better separation and validation of evaporation and transpiration components, which is crucial for accurate modeling in varied vegetation and climatic conditions, as shown in the findings related to the TSEB model application in strongly advective environments.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度协方差测量的结合，似乎为异质景观中的蒸散发模型提供了一种可靠的验证方法。它允许更好地分离和验证蒸发和蒸腾成分，这对于在不同植被和气候条件下的准确建模至关重要，正如与TSEB模型在强烈平流环境中的应用相关的研究结果所示。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your opinion on the challenges of obtaining accurate component temperatures for soil and vegetation when using thermal infrared cameras in agricultural areas with strong advection?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在强对流的农业区域使用热红外相机获取土壤和植被的准确温度的挑战的看法是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The challenges are significant, particularly due to errors in image classification and atmospheric interference, which can lead to overestimation of canopy temperatures. However, using high-precision thermal infrared cameras can still yield reliable data when combined with careful methodological approaches, such as correcting for atmospheric radiation and transmittance effects, as evidenced by the successful application in the TSEB model validation.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 挑战是显著的，特别是由于图像分类中的错误和大气干扰，这可能导致对树冠温度的高估。然而，使用高精度热红外相机结合仔细的方法学方法，例如校正大气辐射和透射效应，仍然可以获得可靠的数据，这在TSEB模型验证中的成功应用得到了证明。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you assess the impact of multiscale observation data from the HiWATER experiment on advancing eco-hydrological research in oasis-desert areas?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评估HiWATER实验的多尺度观测数据对推进绿洲-沙漠地区生态水文研究的影响？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The multiscale observation data from the HiWATER experiment significantly enhances eco-hydrological research by providing comprehensive datasets across multiple observation scales and landscapes. This approach addresses the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations and facilitates a better understanding of eco-hydrological processes, particularly the interaction between oasis and desert systems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验的多尺度观测数据显著增强了生态水文研究，通过提供跨多个观测尺度和景观的综合数据集。这种方法解决了多尺度观测数据稀缺的问题，有助于更好地理解生态水文过程，特别是绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges of collecting multiscale observational data for eco-hydrological processes in diverse terrains like oasis-desert areas.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在像绿洲-沙漠地区这样的多样地形中收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Collecting multiscale observational data in such areas is challenging due to limited availability of observations across different scales. To address this, the HiWATER experiment utilized a hierarchically nested instrumentation approach, including a sparse network for oasis-desert interactions, superstations, eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and airborne remote sensing missions using technologies like LiDAR and thermal imagers. This comprehensive setup aimed to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes effectively.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在这些地区收集多尺度观测数据具有挑战性，因为不同尺度的观测可用性有限。为了解决这个问题，HiWATER实验采用了分层嵌套的仪器方法，包括用于绿洲-沙漠相互作用的稀疏网络、超级站、涡度协方差塔、自动气象站以及使用激光雷达和热成像仪等技术的空中遥感任务。这一综合设置旨在有效捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how stable isotopes are used to validate evapotranspiration estimates in complex agricultural landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解稳定同位素如何用于验证复杂农业景观中的蒸散发估算。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Stable isotopes of oxygen and hydrogen are used alongside eddy covariance measurements to validate estimates of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration. By analyzing the ratios of these isotopes, researchers can better validate the partitioning of evapotranspiration into its components (E/ET% and T/ET%) and compare these with the modeled outputs from models like the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model, thereby enhancing the accuracy of ET estimates in agricultural landscapes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 稳定的氧和氢同位素与涡度协方差测量一起用于验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的估算。通过分析这些同位素的比率，研究人员可以更好地验证蒸散发的组成部分（E/ET% 和 T/ET%）的划分，并将其与像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的模拟输出进行比较，从而提高农业景观中蒸散发估算的准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the methodologies used for ensuring data quality and processing in flux observation matrices within heterogeneous landscapes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结在异质景观中确保数据质量和处理的流量观测矩阵所使用的方法论。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The methodologies for ensuring data quality and processing in flux observation matrices include several key steps such as outlier removal, time delay correction, angle correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, and density correction. Quality evaluations of flux values are performed, focusing on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics. Data are also screened by removing erroneous instrument data, data around precipitation events, and data with high missing rates. These processes ensure accuracy and reliability in capturing the heterogeneous landscape's evapotranspiration dynamics.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 确保数据质量和处理的通量观测矩阵的方法包括几个关键步骤，如异常值去除、时间延迟校正、角度校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、超声波虚拟温度校正和密度校正。通量值的质量评估侧重于大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征。数据还通过去除错误的仪器数据、降水事件周围的数据以及缺失率高的数据进行筛选。这些过程确保了在捕捉异质景观的蒸散发动态时的准确性和可靠性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the challenges faced in obtaining multiscale observation data for eco-hydrological modeling in heterogeneous surfaces, and suggest potential solutions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 概述在异质表面进行生态水文建模时获取多尺度观测数据所面临的挑战，并提出潜在解决方案。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in obtaining multiscale observation data include the limited availability of such observations and the inherent difficulty in capturing eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces. To address these challenges, the HiWATER experiment utilized hierarchically nested instrumentation scales and a sparse network of sensors to gather multiscale data. Solutions include improving sensor networks, enhancing remote sensing capabilities, and integrating ground-based and airborne observations to capture a comprehensive view of eco-hydrological processes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 获取多尺度观测数据的挑战包括此类观测的有限可用性以及在异质表面上捕捉生态水文过程的固有困难。为了解决这些挑战，HiWATER实验利用了分层嵌套的仪器尺度和稀疏的传感器网络来收集多尺度数据。解决方案包括改善传感器网络、增强遥感能力，以及整合地面和空中观测，以捕捉生态水文过程的全面视图。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the data collection techniques employed for measuring soil and canopy temperatures and their impact on the accuracy of the TSEB model in estimating evapotranspiration.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析用于测量土壤和冠层温度的数据收集技术及其对TSEB模型估算蒸散发准确性的影响。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data collection techniques for measuring soil and canopy temperatures involved using a high-resolution thermal infrared camera and applying the maximum-likelihood method to classify images into soil and canopy pixels. The accuracy of these temperature measurements directly impacts the TSEB model's ability to estimate evapotranspiration by affecting the calculation of soil and canopy component temperatures. Precise temperature separation enhances the model's reliability in estimating latent heat fluxes and evapotranspiration components, thereby improving the model's overall performance under advective conditions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 测量土壤和冠层温度的数据收集技术涉及使用高分辨率热红外相机，并应用最大似然法将图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。这些温度测量的准确性直接影响TSEB模型估算蒸散发的能力，因为它影响土壤和冠层组件温度的计算。精确的温度分离增强了模型在估算潜热通量和蒸散发组件方面的可靠性，从而提高了模型在逆风条件下的整体性能。
